epics.title: Webhook Management Interface
epics.description: Create a user interface for managing webhooks, including listing, adding, editing, and testing webhooks.

stories.title: Develop Webhook Configuration UI
stories.description: Create a management interface at /settings/webhooks for managing webhooks.
acceptance_criteria: Users can list existing webhooks with details such as endpoint URL, events, and status.
Users can add, edit, and delete webhooks.
Users can enable or disable webhooks via a toggle.
Users can test webhooks by sending a sample payload.

agent_context.goal: Enable users to manage their webhook configurations easily.
self_check: Does the UI handle all CRUD operations?
Is the UI responsive and accessible?

stories.title: Implement Webhook Setup Form
stories.description: Provide a form for adding and editing webhooks with validation.
acceptance_criteria: Users must enter a valid HTTPS endpoint URL.
Users can optionally add a description.
Users can select events via checkboxes grouped by category.
A secret key is auto-generated and can be regenerated by the user.
Users can toggle the webhook between active and inactive states.
The URL is validated for reachability before saving.

agent_context.goal: Allow users to configure webhooks with necessary validations.
self_check: Is the endpoint URL validation robust?
Can users regenerate the secret key securely?
Are event selections correctly grouped and saved?

epics.title: Webhook Delivery System
epics.description: Implement a reliable system for delivering webhooks, including queuing, retry mechanisms, and logging.

stories.title: Define Supported Events for Webhooks
stories.description: Define the events for which webhooks can be delivered.
acceptance_criteria: Webhooks can be delivered for project, task, user, and billing events as specified.

agent_context.goal: Ensure webhooks are triggered for relevant events.
self_check: Are event triggers reliable and efficient?

stories.title: Standardize Webhook Payload Format
stories.description: Standardize the payload structure for webhooks.
acceptance_criteria: Payloads must include id, type, created timestamp, data object, and account_id.
Include X-Webhook-Signature header with HMAC-SHA256 signature.

agent_context.goal: Ensure webhook payloads are consistent and secure.
self_check: Is the payload format consistent across all events?
Is the signature generation secure and verifiable?

stories.title: Implement Webhook Delivery Mechanism
stories.description: Implement a reliable delivery system for webhooks.
acceptance_criteria: Queue events in a message queue (SQS/RabbitMQ).
Deliver events within 30 seconds.
Timeout each attempt after 30 seconds.
Retry failed deliveries up to 5 times with exponential backoff.
Mark webhook as failing after 5 consecutive failures.
Alert users via email when a webhook is disabled.

agent_context.goal: Ensure reliable and timely delivery of webhooks.
self_check: Are delivery attempts logged and monitored?
Is the retry logic correctly implemented?
Are users notified of delivery failures?

epics.title: Webhook Monitoring and Rate Limiting
epics.description: Implement monitoring for webhook deliveries and rate limiting to protect destination servers.

stories.title: Maintain Webhook Delivery Logs
stories.description: Maintain logs of webhook deliveries for 30 days.
acceptance_criteria: Logs must include timestamp, event type, HTTP status code, response time, request/response bodies, retry count, and success/failure status.

agent_context.goal: Provide visibility into webhook delivery status and performance.
self_check: Are all relevant details captured in the logs?
Is log retention policy correctly implemented?

stories.title: Implement Manual Retry for Webhooks
stories.description: Allow users to manually retry webhook deliveries.
acceptance_criteria: Users can retry failed deliveries via a 'Retry' button.
Users can replay successful events.
Bulk retry option available for a specified date range.

agent_context.goal: Provide users with control over webhook delivery retries.
self_check: Are retries correctly logged and monitored?

stories.title: Implement Rate Limiting for Webhooks
stories.description: Implement rate limiting to protect destination servers.
acceptance_criteria: Limit to 100 events/second per endpoint.
Queue excess events.
Expose rate limit headers.
Allow customers to configure lower limits.

agent_context.goal: Prevent overloading destination servers with webhook requests.
self_check: Are rate limits configurable by users?
Is rate limiting effective without dropping events?
